intro: Disperma scabridum, commonly known as the rough disperma, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, rough-textured leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Disperma scabridum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
